result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig J Greenwold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by close of business today, January 30, 2017.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must not possess or consume any intoxicating beverages.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, except as prescribed by a licensed physician.
Must have no contact with Tracey Darling, Nichole Hubbell or Mary Berning.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail on February 3, 2017 to submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Must report to Barron County Jail by 12:00 PM (noon) on February 3, 2017.
Huber for work granted.
Credit for 1 day.

Defendant Craig J Greenwold in court with attorney John P Bjork.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bjork recites agreement.  Count 1 amended to possession of methamphetamine 961.41(3g)(g) a Class I Felony.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to amended count.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Court orders PSI.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 30, 2017 at 11:00 am.
